title: Authors and Citation
text: Semião R (2023). varutils: Utility Functions VAR Analisys. R package version 0.0.0.9000,  https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varutils/, https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varutils.
code: @Manual{,   title = {varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys},   author = {Ricardo Semião},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000,  https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varutils/},   url = {https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varutils}, }

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: varutils R package developed provide general utility functions projects involving Vector Auto-Regressive models, specifically vars package. Mainly, functions retrieve results vars objects, manipulate tidyverse, plot commonly needed ggplot graphs, realm IRF’s, FEVD’s, predict graphs, VAR series residual analysis. future, intent add functions quick (thorough) analysis retrieval trends, seasonality, structural breaks, using common methods statistical tests. Additionally, want expand package VAR-like objects. Disclaimer: package early stage life. hasn’t thoroughly tested can present several bugs. don’t recommend using large-scale projects, yet. Please report problems email () github issue. Thank ! Author: Ricardo Semião e Castro (ricardo.semiao@outlook).

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: can install development version varutils GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ricardo-semiao/varutils")

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: Rethink pass large number arguments ggplot. errors expect expect_error calls. Directly test elements ggplots returned functions. tests specifically test_fun(). Add tests “helper” “setup” functions. Rethink test functions list scheme start using rlang errors. Add info/sections functions documentation. See solving less important lintr notes.

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: package: Using styler lintr packages style consistency. Uses testthat vdiffr automate tests. Uses rlang frameworks tidy eval rlang errors.

what: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: ggvar_acf plots result acf call every  series, using facet_wrap. ggvar_ccf plots  cross correlations (similars) series, using  facet_grid.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(   x,   series = NULL,   type = "correlation",   lag.max = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   ...,   geom = "segment",   args_geom = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list() )  ggvar_ccf_grid(   x,   series = NULL,   type = "correlation",   lag.max = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   ...,   geom = "segment",   facet = "ggplot",   args_geom = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list() )  ggvar_ccf_ind(x, serie_x, serie_y, ...)  ggvar_ccf_wrap(x, series, ...)

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: x dataset (object coercible data.frame) "varest" object get residuals . series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). type type ACF computed, passed acf. Can either "correlation", "covariance", "partial". lag.max number lags used calculate ACF, passed acf. defaults 10 * log(nrow(x) / ncol(x), base = 10). ci level confidence ACF confidence interval. Set FALSE omit geom_ribbon. ... Additional arguments passed acf. geom ggplot geom used create plot, 'segment' (default) geom_segment, 'area' geom_area. args_geom Arguments passed chosen geom. args_ribbon Aditional arguments passed geom_ribbon. args_hline Aditional arguments passed geom_hline. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap. facet facet "engine" used. 'ggplot2' facet_grid, 'ggh4x' facet_grid2 serie_x, serie_y Variables chose x y axis ggvar_ccf_ind.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot autocorrelation (and similars) of dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_ccf_grid(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_acf(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: Plots scatterplot residuals versus fitted values VAR model,  using ggplot2.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(   x,   series = NULL,   args_point = list(),   args_hline = list(),   args_facet = list() )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: x "varest" object get residuals fitted values . series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). args_point Aditional arguments passed geom_point. args_hline Aditional arguments passed geom_hline. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_x"))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: Plots histogram residuals VAR model, variables  dataset, overlapped normal curve.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(   x,   series = NULL,   plot_normal = TRUE,   args_histogram = list(bins = 30),   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list() )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). plot_normal Logical, whether normal curve plotted. args_histogram Aditional arguments passed geom_histogram. args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]))

what: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: Plots result fevd call.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(   x,   n.ahead = NULL,   series = NULL,   geom = "bar",   colors = NULL,   args_geom = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: x "varest" object pass fevd, , directly, "varfevd" object. n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed fevd. Unused `x` "varfevd" object. series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). geom ggplot geom used create plot, 'segment' (default) geom_segment, 'area' geom_area, 'line' geom_line. colors vector colors variable. Passed toscale_color_manual. See vignette("colors"). args_geom Arguments passed chosen geom. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap. ... geom="line", additional arguments geom_point

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), n.ahead = 10)

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: Plots fitted values VAR model, versus actual values.  ggvar_fit Plots serie facet. ggvar_fit_colored  plots graph, different color.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: ggvar_fit(   x,   compare = TRUE,   series = NULL,   index = 1:x$totobs,   linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),   args_line = list(),   args_facet = list() )  ggvar_fit_colored(   x,   compare = TRUE,   series = NULL,   index = 1:x$totobs,   colors = NULL,   linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),   args_line = list() )

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: x "varest" object get fitted values . compare Logical, "original" values plotted? series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must  length equal x$obs. Defaults numeric sequence. linetypes vector line types (original, predicted). Passed toscale_linetype_manual. args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap. colors vector colors variable. Passed toscale_color_manual. See vignette("colors").

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: x <- vars::VAR(freeny[-2]) ggvar_fit(x, args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_fit_colored(x)

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: x "varest" object pass irf, , directly, "varirf" object. n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed irf. Unused x "varirf". series_impulse character vector variables consider impulses. Defaults (NULL). series_response character vector variables consider responses. Defaults (NULL). ci level confidence irf. Set FALSE omit. ... Additional arguments passed irf. facet facet "engine" used. 'ggplot2' facet_grid, 'ggh4x' facet_grid2 args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line. args_hline Aditional arguments passed geom_hline. args_ribbon Aditional arguments passed geom_ribbon. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_grid.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf

what: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: Plots result predict.varest call. option  overlay true variables, provided test dataset.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(   x,   data_test = NULL,   n.ahead = NULL,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   ...,   linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),   args_line = list(),   args_ribbon = list(fill = NA, linetype = 2, color = "blue"),   args_facet = list() )

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: x "varest" object get predictions , , directly, "varprd" object. data_test test data set (object coercible data.frame), actual series values. NULL, comparison made. n.ahead integer. number periods predict, passed predict. Defaults nrow(data_test) horizon "varprd" object (NULL). series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must  length equal n.ahead. Defaults numeric sequence. ci level confidence prediction confidence interval. Set FALSE omit. Passed predict. ... Additional arguments passed predict. linetypes vector line types (original, predicted). Passed toscale_linetype_manual. args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line. args_ribbon Aditional arguments passed geom_ribbon. args_facet Aditional arguments passed facet_wrap.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(stats::predict(vars::VAR(freeny[-2])),   args_facet = list(scales = "free_y") )  ggvar_predict(vars::VAR(freeny[-2][1:30, ]), freeny[-2][31:39, ],   args_facet = list(scales = "free_y") )

text: x result VARselect call. criteria criteria considered. "AIC", "HQ", "SC", "FPE". trans transformation apply criteria result (vector). Can function, "none" (default), "index" create index numbers. args_line Aditional arguments passed geom_line.

title: Plot Information Criteria for VAR Lag Selection — ggvar_select
code: ggvar_select(vars::VARselect(freeny[-2]))

text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector variables (column names) consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must  length equal x$obs nrow(x). what: varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varutils-package
title: varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varutils-package
text: Functions commonly needed ggplot graphs Vector Auto-Regressive models, like IRF's, FEVD's, predict graphs, VAR residual analysis. Soon contain functions common tests statistics, VAR-like objects.

title: varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varutils-package
text: Maintainer: Ricardo Semião ricardo.semiao@outlook.com

title: varutils (development version)
text: 11/13/2023 - Remade code styling styler lintr, created setup helpers (“setup_ggvar_…”) 11/10/2023 - Added testthat (& vdiffr) basic tests 11/06/2023 - Initial update github (development version, yet tested CRAN suitable)
